carrier.body:
ARC ANNOUCEMENT

My ARC along with all applications accessed via My ARC will be unavailable on Sunday, June 9 from 1:00 a.m. until 7:00 a.m. Eastern Time to perform a crucial system update.

During this extended maintenance window, you will not be able to access My ARC or any of its tools or products. Access will be restored as soon as the update completes. We apologize for any inconvenience this outage may cause to your operations. Thank you for your patience.

Blog
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom
Airline Newsletter

Get more insight into your U.S. travel agency sales than ever before with the addition of segment-level data, plus ARC’s innovative report-building capability. With 15+ fields to choose from, this customizable query gives you the ability to analyze data in a whole new way.

Learn More

ARC's Chief Executive Officer, Mike Premo, shares his perspective on ARC's investment in blockchain developer BlockSkye.

Read More

ARC's NDC guides include several considerations for airlines and travel agencies as they build their NDC retailing strategies.

Learn More

agency.body:
ARC ANNOUCEMENT

My ARC along with all applications accessed via My ARC will be unavailable on Sunday, June 9 from 1:00 a.m. until 7:00 a.m. Eastern Time to perform a crucial system update.

During this extended maintenance window, you will not be able to access My ARC or any of its tools or products. Access will be restored as soon as the update completes. We apologize for any inconvenience this outage may cause to your operations. Thank you for your patience.

Blog
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

TravelConnect 2019 early bird registration is now open! Join ARC on October 3-4 at Lansdowne Resort for an inspiring two-day program that will illuminate emerging trends, technology and customer experience in airline retailing

Register Today

See for yourself how convenient it is to use TASF – ARC’s credit card processing service.

Learn More

ARC's NDC guide includes several considerations for travel agencies as they build their NDC retailing strategies.

Learn More

Read about the latest enhancements to Agency BI – ARC's business intelligence tool for travel agencies that provides a holistic view of an agency's travel data, as well as benchmarking capabilities, to improve performance and strengthen supplier relations.

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now

login.body:
What is NDC & how does it work? At today’s @ASTAAgents Corporate Advisory Committee Meeting, ARC’s VP of Product, Doug Mangold, answers these questions & gives a comprehensive view of #NDC in the air travel industry. Learn more about ARC supporting NDC

Learn More

Despite devastating hurricanes in late 2017, air ticket purchases to areas less impacted remain very strong in 2018. Overall, average ticket prices decreased 4% #ARCdata #SpringBreak

Learn More

The theme for this year’s TravelConnect is “Transforming Together” and will feature Dan Clay, Wayne Best and Holly Hegeman. #TravelConnect2018

Learn More

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

The Latest
TAC

ARC Newsroom

TravelConnect 2018 - Transforming Together

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

Read the Story

TravelConnect 2018 featured diverse perspectives on how travel organizations of all sizes can leverage emerging technology and data intelligence to enhance the customer experience and grow a thriving business in the future.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and what ARC's role as it sees distribution evolving.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 featured dynamic discussions on emerging technology — including AI, robotics, predictive analytics, virtual reality and data-driven personalization.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 - Transforming Together

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

Read the Story

TravelConnect 2018 featured diverse perspectives on how travel organizations of all sizes can leverage emerging technology and data intelligence to enhance the customer experience and grow a thriving business in the future.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and what ARC's role as it sees distribution evolving.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 featured dynamic discussions on emerging technology — including AI, robotics, predictive analytics, virtual reality and data-driven personalization.

Learn More

ARC Newsroom

TravelConnect 2018 - Transforming Together

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

Read the Story

TravelConnect 2018 featured diverse perspectives on how travel organizations of all sizes can leverage emerging technology and data intelligence to enhance the customer experience and grow a thriving business in the future.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and what ARC's role as it sees distribution evolving.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 featured dynamic discussions on emerging technology — including AI, robotics, predictive analytics, virtual reality and data-driven personalization.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 - Transforming Together

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

Read the Story

TravelConnect 2018 featured diverse perspectives on how travel organizations of all sizes can leverage emerging technology and data intelligence to enhance the customer experience and grow a thriving business in the future.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and what ARC's role as it sees distribution evolving.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 featured dynamic discussions on emerging technology — including AI, robotics, predictive analytics, virtual reality and data-driven personalization.

Learn More

– Mark Shapiro, Director of Air & Ancillary Products, CIE Tours

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

TravelConnect 2018 - Transforming Together

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

Read the Story

TravelConnect 2018 featured diverse perspectives on how travel organizations of all sizes can leverage emerging technology and data intelligence to enhance the customer experience and grow a thriving business in the future.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and what ARC's role as it sees distribution evolving.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 featured dynamic discussions on emerging technology — including AI, robotics, predictive analytics, virtual reality and data-driven personalization.

Learn More

','body':'

Learn More

Despite devastating hurricanes in late 2017, air ticket purchases to areas less impacted remain very strong in 2018. Overall, average ticket prices decreased 4% #ARCdata #SpringBreak

The theme for this year’s TravelConnect is “Transforming Together” and will feature Dan Clay, Wayne Best and Holly Hegeman. #TravelConnect2018

Fully integrated with ARC's tools for memo management and analysis, ARC’s Revenue Recovery Services (RRS) helps airlines effectively resolve and recover outstanding agency debit memos.

Learn More

In 2017, ARC facilitated 230,000 memos worth $94 million for 76 airlines. With Revenue Recovery Services (RRS), airlines successfully resolved nearly 70 percent of their debit memos in less than two months. See how your airline can utilize RRS.

The Latest

Airline Newsletter

Fully integrated with ARC's tools for memo management and analysis, ARC’s Revenue Recovery Services (RRS) helps airlines effectively resolve and recover outstanding agency debit memos.

Learn More

Learn how access to debit memo analysis and financial recovery assistance helped Aeroflot get a handle on travel agency debt.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer offers insights into memo and ticketing data, along with industry benchmarks, to help airlines understand debit memo trends, improve processes and ultimately reduce debit memos.

Learn More

In 2017, ARC facilitated 230,000 memos worth $94 million for 76 airlines. With Revenue Recovery Services (RRS), airlines successfully resolved nearly 70 percent of their debit memos in less than two months. See how your airline can utilize RRS.

Learn More

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

Read the Story

TravelConnect 2018 featured diverse perspectives on how travel organizations of all sizes can leverage emerging technology and data intelligence to enhance the customer experience and grow a thriving business in the future.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and what ARC's role as it sees distribution evolving.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 featured dynamic discussions on emerging technology — including AI, robotics, predictive analytics, virtual reality and data-driven personalization.

Learn More

Fully integrated with ARC's tools for memo management and analysis, ARC’s Revenue Recovery Services (RRS) helps airlines effectively resolve and recover outstanding agency debit memos.

ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

Notice of Changes to the CTDRA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Corporate Travel Department Reporting Agreement (CTDRA). The primary changes relate to updates to the types of CTD contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the CTDRA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the CTDRA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

Set your agency up for success in 2019. Memo Analyzer can help you reduce time spent researching, compiling and analyzing your agency's 2018 debit memos.

Learn More

Travel Agency Service Fee (TASF) is a robust payment solution that enables travel agencies to manage large or complex transactions for any travel-related goods or services. Learn three unexpected ways this credit card processing tool can help your business thrive.

Learn More

ARC’s Vice President and Chief Information Officer, Dickie Oliver, shares with The Company Dime his perspective on digital transformation. In this column, Oliver emphasized that transformation isn’t exclusive to technology — it permeates the entire organization.

Read the Article

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now

ARC Newsroom
Airline Newsletter

Fully integrated with ARC's tools for memo management and analysis, ARC’s Revenue Recovery Services (RRS) helps airlines effectively resolve and recover outstanding agency debit memos.

Learn More

Learn how access to debit memo analysis and financial recovery assistance helped Aeroflot get a handle on travel agency debt.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer offers insights into memo and ticketing data, along with industry benchmarks, to help airlines understand debit memo trends, improve processes and ultimately reduce debit memos.

Learn More

In 2017, ARC facilitated 230,000 memos worth $94 million for 76 airlines. With Revenue Recovery Services (RRS), airlines successfully resolved nearly 70 percent of their debit memos in less than two months. See how your airline can utilize RRS.

Learn More

ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

Set your agency up for success in 2019. Memo Analyzer can help you reduce time spent researching, compiling and analyzing your agency's 2018 debit memos.

Learn More

Travel Agency Service Fee (TASF) is a robust payment solution that enables travel agencies to manage large or complex transactions for any travel-related goods or services. Learn three unexpected ways this credit card processing tool can help your business thrive.

Learn More

ARC’s Vice President and Chief Information Officer, Dickie Oliver, shares with The Company Dime his perspective on digital transformation. In this column, Oliver emphasized that transformation isn’t exclusive to technology — it permeates the entire organization.

Read the Article

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Airline Newsletter

Fully integrated with ARC's tools for memo management and analysis, ARC’s Revenue Recovery Services (RRS) helps airlines effectively resolve and recover outstanding agency debit memos.

Learn More

Learn how access to debit memo analysis and financial recovery assistance helped Aeroflot get a handle on travel agency debt.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer offers insights into memo and ticketing data, along with industry benchmarks, to help airlines understand debit memo trends, improve processes and ultimately reduce debit memos.

Learn More

In 2017, ARC facilitated 230,000 memos worth $94 million for 76 airlines. With Revenue Recovery Services (RRS), airlines successfully resolved nearly 70 percent of their debit memos in less than two months. See how your airline can utilize RRS.

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Corporate Travel Department Reporting Agreement (CTDRA). The primary changes relate to updates to the types of CTD contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the CTDRA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the CTDRA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom
Airline Newsletter

Fully integrated with ARC's tools for memo management and analysis, ARC’s Revenue Recovery Services (RRS) helps airlines effectively resolve and recover outstanding agency debit memos.

Learn More

Learn how access to debit memo analysis and financial recovery assistance helped Aeroflot get a handle on travel agency debt.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer offers insights into memo and ticketing data, along with industry benchmarks, to help airlines understand debit memo trends, improve processes and ultimately reduce debit memos.

Learn More

In 2017, ARC facilitated 230,000 memos worth $94 million for 76 airlines. With Revenue Recovery Services (RRS), airlines successfully resolved nearly 70 percent of their debit memos in less than two months. See how your airline can utilize RRS.

Learn More
'},'agency':{'body':'
ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

Set your agency up for success in 2019. Memo Analyzer can help you reduce time spent researching, compiling and analyzing your agency's 2018 debit memos.

Learn More

Travel Agency Service Fee (TASF) is a robust payment solution that enables travel agencies to manage large or complex transactions for any travel-related goods or services. Learn three unexpected ways this credit card processing tool can help your business thrive.

Learn More

ARC’s Vice President and Chief Information Officer, Dickie Oliver, shares with The Company Dime his perspective on digital transformation. In this column, Oliver emphasized that transformation isn’t exclusive to technology — it permeates the entire organization.

Read the Article

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now

ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the CTDRA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Corporate Travel Department Reporting Agreement (CTDRA). The primary changes relate to updates to the types of CTD contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the CTDRA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the CTDRA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

Technology, service, content, data and automation are all key areas of focus for travel management companies (TMCs). But how are TMCs prioritizing their investments in each of those areas?

Find Out Now

Be data-driven in 2019: Aria is an easy way to view, analyze and download your weekly ARC-settled ticketing data through an online reporting tool or a raw data feed.

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now

ARC Newsroom

TravelConnect 2018 - Transforming Together

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The American Airlines legend sat down for an intimate, "Anything Goes" interview with PlaneBusiness Banter's Holly Hegeman.

Read the Story

TravelConnect 2018 featured diverse perspectives on how travel organizations of all sizes can leverage emerging technology and data intelligence to enhance the customer experience and grow a thriving business in the future.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and what ARC's role as it sees distribution evolving.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 featured dynamic discussions on emerging technology — including AI, robotics, predictive analytics, virtual reality and data-driven personalization.

Learn More

The primary changes relate to updates to the types of CTD contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the CTDRA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the CTDRA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

When ARC’s data community launched, there were three keys to its success: 1. A $0 budget, 2. No management allowed and 3. Contribution required. Hear from Chuck Thackston and Shitalkumar Sabne on how ARC built its Business Intelligence Community of Practice from the ground up.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer provides travel agencies with actionable intelligence and insights into Memo Manager data, helping your business measure performance and uncover areas for improvement.

Learn More

Cost savings continue to be the leading focus of business travel management, but this study challenges those business practices. Learn what matters most to road warriors and why companies should focus on trip success, instead.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and shares ARC's vision of how the industry can achieve this evolved future.

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now

ARC Newsroom

ARC Selects Amazon Web Services to Accelerate Transformation

ARC is now partnering with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enhance its ability to deliver on all of the key requirements of ARC’s long-term transformation program.

Learn More

ARC Boosts Performance, Flexibility and Efficiency with Snowflake

ARC announced the deployment of a cloud-based data warehouse from Snowflake Computing to improve speed, efficiency and flexibility for its more than $88 billion of transactions per year.

Learn More

ARC Brings Alipay Payment Option to Travel Agency Channel

ARC announced that it is now offering airlines the ability to accept Alipay as a form of payment for tickets sold through the travel agency channel. Alipay is a mobile and online payment platform based in China with more than 500 million users.

Learn More

Achieving Better Business Results: Insights from U.S. Road Warriors

'},'agency':{'body':'
ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

When ARC’s data community launched, there were three keys to its success: 1. A $0 budget, 2. No management allowed and 3. Contribution required. Hear from Chuck Thackston and Shitalkumar Sabne on how ARC built its Business Intelligence Community of Practice from the ground up.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer provides travel agencies with actionable intelligence and insights into Memo Manager data, helping your business measure performance and uncover areas for improvement.

Learn More

Cost savings continue to be the leading focus of business travel management, but this study challenges those business practices. Learn what matters most to road warriors and why companies should focus on trip success, instead.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and shares ARC's vision of how the industry can achieve this evolved future.

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now

ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the CTDRA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Corporate Travel Department Reporting Agreement (CTDRA). The primary changes relate to updates to the types of CTD contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the CTDRA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the CTDRA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

Discover insights on travel policy guidelines, booking trends and compliance from ARC's research partnership with the GBTA Foundation.

Learn More

Business travel has long been managed by focusing on cost savings. This study challenges the wisdom of that approach. Instead, senior management should prioritize trip success rates and road warrior retention.

Learn More

TravelConnect 2018 - Transforming Together

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

'},'agency':{'body':'

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

When ARC’s data community launched, there were three keys to its success: 1. A $0 budget, 2. No management allowed and 3. Contribution required. Hear from Chuck Thackston and Shitalkumar Sabne on how ARC built its Business Intelligence Community of Practice from the ground up.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer provides travel agencies with actionable intelligence and insights into Memo Manager data, helping your business measure performance and uncover areas for improvement.

Learn More

Cost savings continue to be the leading focus of business travel management, but this study challenges those business practices. Learn what matters most to road warriors and why companies should focus on trip success, instead.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and shares ARC's vision of how the industry can achieve this evolved future.

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now
'},'ctd':{'body':'
ARC ANNOUCEMENT

Notice of Changes to the CTDRA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Corporate Travel Department Reporting Agreement (CTDRA). The primary changes relate to updates to the types of CTD contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the CTDRA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the CTDRA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars

Learn More

What does the future of air travel look like? It’s seamless, automated, fast and frictionless. Hear from travel industry leaders about how they’re transforming their businesses to enhance the traveler experience.

The Latest

ARC Newsroom

ARC Selects Amazon Web Services to Accelerate Transformation

ARC is now partnering with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enhance its ability to deliver on all of the key requirements of ARC’s long-term transformation program.

Learn More

ARC Boosts Performance, Flexibility and Efficiency with Snowflake

ARC announced the deployment of a cloud-based data warehouse from Snowflake Computing to improve speed, efficiency and flexibility for its more than $88 billion of transactions per year.

Learn More

ARC Brings Alipay Payment Option to Travel Agency Channel

ARC announced that it is now offering airlines the ability to accept Alipay as a form of payment for tickets sold through the travel agency channel. Alipay is a mobile and online payment platform based in China with more than 500 million users.

Learn More

Achieving Better Business Results: Insights from U.S. Road Warriors

Business travel has long been managed by focusing on cost savings. This study challenges the wisdom of that approach. Instead, senior management should prioritize trip success rates and road warrior retention.

'},'agency':{'body':'

Notice of Changes to the ARA: Effective February 1, 2019

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Agent Reporting Agreement (ARA). The primary ARA changes relate to updates to the types of agency contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the ARA changes in more detail, click here.

These changes will take effect on February 1, 2019. Please note that in accordance with Section 5 of the ARA, your continued participation with ARC after February 1, 2019, will serve as your acceptance of the amendments.

The Latest
TAC
Events & Webinars
ARC Newsroom

When ARC’s data community launched, there were three keys to its success: 1. A $0 budget, 2. No management allowed and 3. Contribution required. Hear from Chuck Thackston and Shitalkumar Sabne on how ARC built its Business Intelligence Community of Practice from the ground up.

Learn More

Memo Analyzer provides travel agencies with actionable intelligence and insights into Memo Manager data, helping your business measure performance and uncover areas for improvement.

Learn More

Cost savings continue to be the leading focus of business travel management, but this study challenges those business practices. Learn what matters most to road warriors and why companies should focus on trip success, instead.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and shares ARC's vision of how the industry can achieve this evolved future.

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation

Once a year you must review and affirm key information about your agency. Please note, you must disable your pop-up blocker, have Adobe Flash installed and have access to the Accreditation tool in order to complete the Affirmation.

Affirm Now

Following ARC’s consultation with travel agency representatives, ARC’s Board of Directors approved a number of changes to the Corporate Travel Department Reporting Agreement (CTDRA). The primary changes relate to updates to the types of CTD contacts (including email addresses), changes to the ARC Specialist requirement, elimination of the Satellite Ticket Printer (STP) location classification, and the elimination of references to obsolete ARC traffic documents. A summary of these changes can be found here for your reference. To review the CTDRA changes in more detail, click here..

When ARC’s data community launched, there were three keys to its success: 1. A $0 budget, 2. No management allowed and 3. Contribution required. Hear from Chuck Thackston and Shitalkumar Sabne on how ARC built its Business Intelligence Community of Practice from the ground up.

Learn More

Cost savings continue to be the leading focus of business travel management, but this study challenges those business practices. Learn what matters most to road warriors and why companies should focus on trip success, instead.

Learn More

ARC defines the future of distribution and shares ARC's vision of how the industry can achieve this evolved future.

Learn More

Annual Agency Affirmation
